items: Become familiar with basic Linux terms (e.g., kernel, terminal, OS)

sections.heading: What is Linux?
paragraphs: Linux is an operating system (OS) — like Windows or macOS, but open-source.
It’s built on the Unix philosophy: small programs that do one thing well.
Created by Linus Torvalds in 1991, it started as a hobby project.
Today, Linux powers a wide range of systems.
bullets: IoT devices (smart home gadgets, Raspberry Pi)

sections.text: 96% of the world’s top 1 million servers run Linux!

bullets: Linux is an open-source operating system built on Unix philosophy.
It powers servers, Android devices, IoT devices, and supercomputers.
You can control Linux using the terminal and install coding tools like VS Code.
